channel.title: Isnt this considered harassment?
channel.description:
Alright so wrench_king and i live far far away from spawn, so we could get away from griefers and raiders.
My problem is tom_beta and xx matty xx have made a compound in proximity to ours for the sole purpose of raiding our settlement.
One or 2 raids wouldnt be against the rules but they have attempted to raid us atleast 20+ times, no matter how many times i kill them they keep coming back, everytime i kill them they start go say things like "umad!" "madmadmad" and then proceed to try to start an argument.
Wouldnt this fall under the level of harassment?

item.title: Isnt this considered harassment?
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Issue resolved, no need for a topic now. If you want to debate rules then go to the correct thread.

Read full topic

item.title: Isnt this considered harassment?
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote="(Anthony), post:33, topic:395427"]who gives a shit, the whole point of survival is to be better than the enemy, in this case matty and tom.

you have failed, cry about it or get to building better protection/better armor so you can defeat them.[/quote]

Go away you havent even read anything.

@ Rix, yes our quarrel has been resolved but i do agree with making breaking and entering of any sort against the rules.

Read full topic

item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

I believe I’m too nice when it comes to interpreting the rules. Several individuals in this thread need a warning/mute in-game but that is my opinion.

item.title: Isnt this considered harassment?
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

If anything, this sounds like a case of extreme faggotry. I don’t like how Tom_BETA always goes ‘too bad, the rule wasn’t there before I did x, so if action was taken against me, it’s unfair’. Case in point: his monument in Davidi2’s empire.

I’d also like to quote a paragraph from the current server rules:

The staff reserve the right to interpret these rules any way they see fit. The following rules are more like guidelines. You shouldn't be looking for loopholes in them, rather, you should just get along with them. We're looking for users that use common sense. For example, we would prefer a user that knows, just because something isn't on the rules, that it it isn't necessarily allowed.
This was added to the rules because of a discussion I had with Davidi2. I received a temporary ban from the server because of an edited image of IRC chat logs (which didn't exist in the rules).

If all of badger41’s claims was true, Tom_BETA and Magma828 were indeed harassing him. To me you don’t build a house without knowing that it’s really close to someone’s, discover its existence, break a few blocks to enter it (without the owner’s permission) and start raiding the chests. While raiding chests isn’t breaking any of the rules, griefing in order to raid chests should be.

I don’t know if this conflict has already been solved, but that’s just my 2 cents’ worth. Any op should handle this matter about doing something that is wrong, but isn’t explicitly stated in the rules.

So I put forward a few rules:
No griefing in order to enter someone’s compound. The person has already put in effort to protect his home, breaking a few blocks and placing them back after entering it should be an offense. What is the point of home protection then?

No houses should be built in proximity to someone else’s without permission.

Read full topic

item.title: Isnt this considered harassment?
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“Tom_BETA, post:22, topic:395427”]Please prove we moved there with the intention to just raid you. If that was the case I would of chosen a better location that’s for sure. And as matty said you all yet again assume everyone plays on far render, I play on tiny. Also as Badger said there is a hill meaning seeing his house wasn’t possible.

If 65 block is to close then I guess you need to start knocking down a ton of houses? The lack of clearance on this rule (Since Lin left) has been pathetic. I offered friendly relations, if you don’t want them then I suggest you say so.

Everything myself and matty have done was strictly within the rules, and none of you have proven otherwise. This topic is a last ditch attempt to strike back, nothing more.[/quote]

I never meant to make it seem like i didnt want friendly relations, which i do. Im mearly discussing what was going on, not trying to put anyone down or get anyone in trouble.

Read full topic

item.title: Isnt this considered harassment?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

CoonHunter:

Its rediculous that they are so defensive in atitude on the situation. Imo, as matty just mentioned blocks all of a sudden, I would think he has a guilty gut about something. Either way tho, 65 blocks is.too ficking close not to notice anything. Especially if one base is underground it seems like a hope to hide out, not by chance.

This implied to me that he was accusing us of breaking blocks:

badger41:

And you are allowed to break just enough blocks to get into someones area but if you start to break many blocks its griefing.

And yes, building our house underground was a “hope to hide out”. All of our houses have been underground to reduce the number of times we get griefed/raided.

We’re being defensive because there need to be clear rules on things like this. If 65 blocks is too close, then there should be an actual rule about it. If you’re not allowed to raid a person multiple times, then there should be a rule about that too.

Read full topic

item.title: Isnt this considered harassment?
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

I don’t think it’s smart to put it down to block spacing, it just gets messy and complicated as tom said. I think something more along the lines of if you’re able to view their house in “tiny” render or “short” render. The only complications then would be if a hill is obstructing your view.

Just my opinion.

Read full topic

item.title: Isnt this considered harassment?
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

[quote=“LilXCj, post:27, topic:395427”][quote author=Tom_BETA link=topic=492611.msg3602640#msg3602640 date=1305754237]

I suggest 50-100 blocks. Or far away enough that you won’t be able to see them in far mode.

How is that even debatable? Far mode? I can barely use far mode. Even if this was changed it wouldn’t apply to this situation, I was there before the rule was implemented.
[/quote]

Notice I used ‘or’. That means I know it could be a problem for those who can’t use far mode (like me).[/quote]

That’s not understandable.

Either way using set numbers is a stupid idea, why does every rule have to be a complete mess? You’re now going to have people counting blocks in every direction to ensure they’re allowed to build there. You then have spacing issues, if someone counts 200 blocks in 1 direction and someone else’s house is 150 blocks away from there they can’t build there.

People will make mistakes, and will have their property removed which isn’t good at all. A quick solution would be to stop the moaning because you’re being raided.

Read full topic

item.title: Isnt this considered harassment?
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

Please prove we moved there with the intention to just raid you. If that was the case I would of chosen a better location that’s for sure. And as matty said you all yet again assume everyone plays on far render, I play on tiny. Also as Badger said there is a hill meaning seeing his house wasn’t possible.

If 65 block is to close then I guess you need to start knocking down a ton of houses? The lack of clearance on this rule (Since Lin left) has been pathetic. I offered friendly relations, if you don’t want them then I suggest you say so.

Everything myself and matty have done was strictly within the rules, and none of you have proven otherwise. This topic is a last ditch attempt to strike back, nothing more.

Read full topic

And you are allowed to break just enough blocks to get into someones area but if you start to break many blocks its griefing.

I said 1 or 2 raids isnt hurting anything but when you are having to deal with someone trying to raid you every other minute, it gets excessive and ridiculous.

We broke two cacti the first time because we couldn’t find the entrance, but after that we just walked in. We didn’t destroy any other blocks.[/quote]

I didnt say you broke blocks

item.title: Isnt this considered harassment?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“badger41, post:14, topic:395427”][quote author=xx matty xx link=topic=492611.msg3601943#msg3601943 date=1305677144]

Chances are if you walk for 1 day in a direction you are very unlikely to wind up within 65 blocks of our settlement.

Just sayin.

Not really. There are only 4 (logical) directions to take and it’s in line with many other structures on the map. When you set off, you probably did the same as us - started early in the morning, walked throughout the day, then shat yourself at night and built a shelter.
[/quote]

Actually we looked for a place in a medium sized desert because we wanted to build a desert style structure(s) and ended up picking out the area which we were through the world map.[/quote]
What a shame. We didn’t look for you, and even if we did it wouldn’t be against the rules.

Read full topic
